This a 10 minute experience that shows what VR cinema might look like. The problem is the terrible resolution and lack of anything close to a true black with consumer grade VR headsets. It makes the experience feel like a blurry dream. With Quest+link you  have to point your eyes at your selection (i.e. Play All) and quickly press the left menu button to select. Sometimes that still doesn't work so press every button until it selects.
It's not perfect, but I thought it was pretty cool.
There's not a lot that happens here but it's a great example of what we can hope for in cinematic experiences in the future.
I downloaded it and that's it.  It just did no run.  My computer meets and exceeds all the recommended specs.  I keep clicking on "Start" and nothing happens.
I like it, and since it is free I can't complain too much, but the image res seems low.
I have the stuttering, but unlike others my cpu is working at 100% and my 1080gpu work at 12%. ;) wish the developer bound the app to the gpu more than the cpu in this case.

Wow thats what a movie is going to be like in the future, 
that was great just to short.

Read some comments about high end PC struggling with running it. I only have a GTX 1060 3GB and it runs perfectly smooth. Even with streaming it to my quest. The "movie" is amazing looking and the atmosphere is top notch.
REALLY wanted to like this..... problem is... massive continual studder, running wayyy beyond recommended specs with a 1080TI gpu.. cranked.. overclocked.. blah blah studder.. shame really..

This is the kind of experience i was dreaming of when i first heard about VR. I hope to be able to watch an entire movie in VR in the future and be my own cameraman. Yes the chapters are short (around 4 minutes), yes the resolution could be better but this is a free demo and it's very promising.

I enjoyed every second of it and will watch it again, and again with a lot of pleasure.

one_reviews_text:
It's a shame I can't view this in actual HD because outside of the low resolution it's seriously impressive. This really is a taste of the future of VR cinema. Once you can watch full-length movies like this inside VR and in proper HD+ quality (alongside currently being able to look 360 degrees all around you in stereoscopic 3D and with 3D audio too), boy is that gonna be impressive!

Oculus, when the hell are we Rift owners going to get to view the 5K versions of videos? It's sooo frustration to constantly hear about people viewing them on the likes of Go, yet I can't view them in 5K on my Rift for reasons that are totally beyond me. What's up with that?
I wish it was 1 or 2 hours long...

The background feels like a blurry 2-D picture and I could not feel such a field of depth as felt from the other available VR demo titles. Maybe due to low budget. If the VR movies from Universal would be like this, I would rather not watch it.
Does not work at all.  Displays error message regarding default graphics card. Very lame...

review_title: Well worth the price of admission!
one_reviews_text: It's a little dim on my Rift and the opening Universal logo stuttered a bit but the rest was fine.  The stuttering could be because I do not have the recommended processor although it benchmarks close.  My graphic card is fine, however.
Nothing special and very blurry.

Ran Perfectly before the up date!

Now just crashes out before it reaches 45s. of run.

UPDATE:
Just tried it again, it ran all the way through, BUT very Jerky, and did NOT appear to be at normal speed.

The Startup LOGO was very badly stuttering, and breaking up.
Was really looking forward to this... But I can't even get the game to run.  Uninstall. Reinstalled. Meets all the spectsm everything updated.  It just won't run.  It just won't load up.
review_feedback: Hi S. Taylor-T, we'd like to help you with the load issue. Could you send an email to qa@felixandpaul.com explaining the issue and including your CPU, GPU and OS information?

one_reviews_text: The first time I tried this experience I nearly fell over, since I didn't know it would just be a 360 (3D) video, but mostly due to the opening sequence conveying movement along two axis of rotation, coupled with no stationary visual anchor. This continues through the whole experience, and the slow camera motion might even be worse than the opening! It's clear that the director was just handed a big 360 camera rig, and decided to use it like a normal camera, with plenty of follow shots. Sure, it looks great, but it FEELS awful.

No. It's not the Unreal Engine.  
It's the best 360 Stereoscopic video I have ever seen.  The creatures look REAL.    Amazing!  The "Unversal" logo at the start was really cool.  My only wish was that it was longer.   However, I understand the reasoning.  If it had been much longer there might not be a reason to go see the movie.   I was walking among the dinosaurs.  Oh yeah, with 'copters flying above me.
This short movie depicts the 3-D aspect of VR pretty good. I'd recommend this, although the replay value is relatively low.

Although I liked the videos, I had to go through constant stuttering all the way. I ran it on Fx-8350, 16Gb Ram and EVGA 1060. I will try it again on 1080 which is on its way and see how it performs and if this video card related.

(old version of review)
Well, that was pretty cool, high resolution, interesting to watch, but i've met so many fps problems, that it was really uncomfortable to watch.
i5-4670
GTX 970
--------------------------------------
UPD 2 years later:
upgraded my pc, now it's Ryzen 5 3600 + RTX 2070 super, no fps problems, comfortable to watch, pleasant experience for new VR users.
I liked it. If you go in with the right excepectations it's a few enjoyable minutes.

Hi, since I wanted to update your application, it's always "stuck" to "finish the installation". Impossible to download / install it ... Do you have issues? Since days I'm trying, but same everytime. Impossible to launch your application.
review_feedback: Hi ziloub, we've updated the app. Could you download the app and see if it fixes the issue? If not, please send QA@felixandpaul.com an email explaining the issue and including what headset you are using. We'll be able to help you from there. Also, a reminder that Oculus recently set the minimum specs for Rift to Windows 10; if you are using an older version of Windows, that may be the issue.

review_title: Stutters and Choppy Framerate on PC
one_reviews_text: This was rendered in 60FPS. If you're using the Oculus Rift for PC, it will stutter and lag because the hardware is at 90FPS. This will only work for Oculus GO.
Had no problem running the experience and looked great! Like how they used the original t-rex as well. Well worth the free download ;)
This is my favourite Vr Experience, it's so real looking!
A movie, where you just sit back and enjoy. It's short but well made. Worth downloading to showcase your VR, but thats about it. Working flawless on my i5, 1060, 16Gb rig.
This 8 minute experience is an awesome ride through a pre-historic landscape. I felt like I was watching Planet Earth: Dinosaurs. Definitely worth checking out!!

I see some people have the same problem - it doesn't start up  - just stays in 'loading' mode and on the PC it displays a message that states that the video card should be the main card... it is a computer with one card an it is the only one. No other VR software has this kind of issue. I wish I could run it somehow... Any help from developer, please?
[...] few weeks after this comment the developers have contacted me and after changing the driver settings the movie has started to work. Definitely worth seeing.
review_feedback: Hi bujarek, we'd like to help you with the loading issue. Could you send an email to qa@felixandpaul.com explaining the issue and including your CPU, GPU and OS information? Thanks!

one_reviews_text: Don't deceive yourself. This isn't a game but a CGI movie. There is no interaction, no controls. Even though, it's really beautiful and promise a lot for the future of movies.

Nice little movie to watch,  well done to the creators, can feel a bit motionsick as the movie plays, think if you were in an open top jeep and drioving around would be a better concept. Like in the movie, lol
bad vr implementation

This was a awesome experience. I was hesitant at first because I thought you might get attacked being in a natural habitat with blue the raptor. But you dont. Its a very chill jurrasic world experience you can let your kids watch if they love dinosaurs. Very impressed. If I knew more about it Id help the project as I do stuff in unreal and unity. Im looking forward to more!

The video is good as long as the viewer is aware there is nothing accurate about the Dinosaurs ( such as the way Dinosaur make  their sound, and how there isnt any feathers on them ).

Of course though, its set in the Jurrassic Park universe so one shouldnt expect it to be accurate.  

As far as the content, its great.  I would even pay for a 30 min. to 1 hour experience to follow blue around, and other Dinosaurs ( 30 minutes to an hour each Dinosaurs ). 

What would be even greater though, its to make the whole thing as accurate as we can (based on modern knowledge), and have us see the ordinary life of specific Dinosaur. 

I see lots of potential with these videos.
Doesnt even start.  Hence the one star rating

one_reviews_text: This is just a terrible VR experience. Immediately with the Universal logo you are spun around and moved without your intention. Clearly this studio has never developed a VR game as it's breaking all of the rules of comfort. Not sure why its rated as Comfortable but as an experienced VR player and developer this is one of the few titles where I immediately felt sick. Devs (or ad agency), please play some games and research what makes a good vr experience before submitting to the store.
Maravilhoso, esse é o futuro do cinema!!!
Will not start!!!
not vr
Two short 360-films where you tag along a velociraptor for a couple of minutes. For free this is definitely worth downloading. I want full-length movies like this :)

Tried to run with my usual setup, 1080 through an external enclosure I have for my laptop. Got prompted that the app needs to run with the 'default' card. Never had this with any other app. Switched to the built-in 1060 which works pretty well in most cases. No luck either even efter restarts etc., same prompt keeps coming up. I hate to give a one star as a developer myself but this is just lacklustre implementation.

Hello GameFutures,
We're very sorry to hear you're having problems using our application. Could you please contact us directly at qa@felixandpaul.com to allow us to gather more details on your laptop configuration in order to diagnose and resolve the issue. Thank you in advance for your patience and collaboration.

one_reviews_text: it doesn't start. GTX 1080

Come on give me a break on the oculus rift, is this best a big budget studio can do? burry as hell and the stereoscopic effect is hardly there. Another piece of crap pushed out to market a big budget fim. I guess this means the movie will be crap as well.... I smell money grab already.

I was skeptical this would be very cool, but full 360 3D video with blockbuster cinema quality visuals is incredible in VR. Can't wait for the day when realtime rendering catches up to this level of quality. 100% recommend!

WOW...Loved this short experience.  I got so excited and scared that I snatched my headset off while laughing hysterically!  Took about 3 seconds and went back in and luckily it was on pause so I resumed to finish an exhilirating immersive VR experience.  Hoping for much more VR experiences like this.  Cherry on the top is that it was FREE too.  SWEET.

will there be a game where you get to be the indoraptor in first person and destroy humans? i want to be the indoraptor with my touch controllers in first person view, hunting and destroying humans. please, i have always wanted to BE the dinosaur. i have watched the new movie, and i would desperately be the indoraptor.

Its free and it was fun. But to write an honest review, i have to give critics.
This way of watching movies isn't going to be on the CV1 and If you have to stand in order to get the whole scene than it's flawed from the beginning.
There must be a way to be interactivly involved, by either be able to be anywhere in the scene or by making use of hotspots. eitherway im looking forward to a seemless experience

This was an awesome experience, it would be cool if there was a longer version with a real story line, but that's very hard to make. I still love it and the quality is great. And the game file is VERY small when you compare it to 1080p60 footage from geforce experience.

I don't know if the scale is realistic but those dino's were very intimidating. I don't get creeped out quickly but when blue stood up and I noticed how big she was I got a little uncomfortable and had to check if I was still inside my room ;p .
launches to red screen in VR
Right from the outset, a non stop stuttering extravaganza.
A nice experience. hope to have new episode

Will not run at all while all my other VR games work perfectly.   Progam keeps giving an error that says I need to plug my head gear into my main video card.  No other program has this issue.  I only gave this a rating of 1 star because zero stars wasn't avaliable.
it crashes immediately..
review_feedback: Hi haomaru87, we'd like to help you with the crashing issue. Could you send an email to qa@felixandpaul.com explaining the issue and including your CPU, GPU and OS information?

one_reviews_text: This is an absolutely HORRIBLE VR experience. I just got off PavlovVR (steam game like Counter Strike but in VR) which I had been playing on for 4 hours STRAIGHT, and the 5 minuets which it took to watch this "experience" gave me more eye strain than Pavlov had. Additionally the animation quality in the actual video is terrible. Im not sure if the experience was just running slower than it was supposed to- I hope that was the case- or if the animation department just did a first draft and thought "Yea good enough." Sometimes when dinosaurs jump or something they just feel weightless or slowed down, the most notable part where I feel like this is the case is in Part 2 when Blue jumps on the Rex, and also when the Rex bats the other larger dinosaur out of the way. The animation is just wrong and unpolished, and I'd be hesitant to claim it as my own. Actually at the credits sequence you're met with studios and companies, not individual animators. I wonder why?
The best

Worth downloading, it's a very short (7.5m) clip.

Hopefully they will release a full movie based on this

It's good and it's quality and it's free. Maybe people think free is too expensive, or just maybe people like hating because they think they are cool. Showed my wife, it got her a bit more interested in VR and the things you can do with it. I only got VR for one very niche simulation and rarely watch any of the free stuff, but I'm glad I did.

Fantastic detail, puts you into the setting very nicely.   Savored every moment of it.  Gives some insight into what high production value VR looks like.  While it's just a visual thing, really makes me want to play a game where I'm a dinosaur.   Anyhow, it's free and worth taking the time to check out.

I have a gtx 1070 with an i7 processor - in spite of that the video quality was really poor. Within the headset the imagery was very blurry and all the edges were aliasing. 1 star for good concept and visualization only.
So awesome!!! Need more chapters! <3
The game doesn't launch as I've experienced with two other "Felix & Paul" experiences. I click play, the application doesn't launch. When I try to open it manually I get the error code (0xc0000142).

one_reviews_text:
The video keeps lagging making it impossible to watch, I'm on a high-end PC with a GTX 1070, I feel like this shouldn't be happening...

* Update:
I changed my motherboard/CPU from a "old" 8-core AMD to a new i7 7700K. Everything is fluid now. My old motherboard had some performance issue with some games, but still could play many high end games on decent speed. 
Most of the problem was on my end, but I still feel like a better handling of computing resources could fix it for others with similar issues.

Nice free VR experience!

one_reviews_text: It looks very nice but with this low fps its unplayable

everythime i start the gam eit gives me a message "this application needs to run on the default graphics card: please plug the oculus into your main graphics card" my oculus is directly plugged into my GTX 1060 and it is my main and only graphics card....please assist

review_title: Best CGI VR Video experience to date
one_reviews_text: I dreamed of seeing dinosaurs as a kid. This is pretty close. It's not roomscale, but the pre-rendered 3D video is photorealistic with near perfect animations. I never thought I'd rate 3d video so highly, but since this is the best CGI 3D video produced to date, 5 stars.

For what it is it's cool, I mean it's a promo for the new Jurassic World movie... it's video with CGI and it's divided into two parts, the video quality is decent but not great and the action within is fun to watch while it lasts.  They should concentrate on 180 degrees on this kind of thing instead of 360, it's just not worth the trade off in quality.  In  general worth watching, hard to complain about free stuff like this with obvious marketing money behind it... is it the highest quality, best dino experience in VR? Nah... but it's fun for a couple of views and that's good enough for me.

After contact many times Oculus support still the game wont start.
Oculus support dont no what to do..

review_title: Fun experience but you can't look around
one_reviews_text: Your head is stationary which means you can't look around. It is simply a 360 degree movie.
this isnt vr, just a 360 stereoscopic video. not 6dof

The video is great but the quality of the vid is too low.....
the 5k version already hit the GO.When wil we get this 5k update?
Boring and very slow developing, don't really see the point in it.
Daddy dino big bully

Nice graphics and animation video but very short. Actually took longer to download (like 5 minutes) than it did to sit through the video. You are just the camera floating through the scenes. No interaction other than looking around a 360 view.

I love the graphics.  This is  what I have been wanting to see.  Now if they could make it into a VR survival game and let you walk around trying to survive the enviroment it would be  fantastic.  Make it so you have to find items, shelter, food,  make weapons, set traps...etc  have the goal get to a location for pick up to win. I think they would have a hit game.

Finished and thought it was only the first chapter, realised it was the whole thing. Very short and only good if sitting and not moving as it's 360 3D and world moves on your movement. Would be nice to allow us to move around, not sure why they made it so limited, oh yeah once again another title made for Gear or GO and ported for Rift without any effort to improve it.

But it's FREE!!!!
Short but pretty well made. A promotion for Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom. The Universal intro was awesome though.
This is a high resolution, fully realized VR experience. I can't believe it's free.

The bad design started at the into sequence- there was no point of reference and motion sickness set in quickly. The entire thing was also only 360 with bad stereoscopic elements. In addition, the line between foreground and background elements was also blurry. To cap it off, it felt like it was only running at 60-75 fps and there was some screen tearing. Otherwise, though, it was a short but sweet experience.

The video is very compressed and studders a bit. I'm assuming it's being streamed, because of the low quality it's hard to get a good sense of scale with the dinosaurs until they get close. But its free and entertaining, so go for it.

This was a very cool video with a ton of polish. The scale of the dinosaurs really comes through well and the action guides your POV nicely. Sounds design also nice. It just makes me want full lightfield playback that much sooner. I can only imagine this kind of pre-rendered experience would be amazing with true stereo depth and higher resolution.
stutters.  enough said.  not enjoyable.
ran fine on with a gtx 1070. Pretty awesome seeing the scale of the dinosaurs, I wish it was a bit more clear but hey it was free!

Seriously impressive snippet of whats possible with VR movies but way, waaaay to short, - if you blink, its over... which is very disappointing.
Whether I watch episode 2 depends on two things, - the length and the price.
This tiny clip definitely feels like a teaser to draw you in, I`m not opposed to that but as I say, - it all depends on the price tag of the full thing.

review_title: Would pay and watch any movie like this
one_reviews_text: I mean obviously there is room for improvement, but 5 stars for how this can work in the future. Out displays limit us currntly but the 360 3D is wonderful and the spatial audio is fantastic. GIVE ME MORE!

review_title: It might be short, but really cool.
one_reviews_text: The VR experience was really nice.  I liked how I could percieve the size of T-rex more accurately than what a movie can offer.

THIS is the future of the movies. 
Here this sort of "demo reel" gave me a glimpse of what might be the future of the Cinema : fully VR (but, for Directors, very hard to keep viewers' eyes in the right direction for the next action...)
Anyway, this one is Excellent on all respects : ambience music, little short story, the beautyful and clever film set, 4 minutes of enjoyment and dream.
Can't wait for the following adventure,
Bravo and Thank You
Sat through it waiting...

review_title: Very good but just a video.
one_reviews_text:
High quality, well made video but just a video.  They need to make a new video format that encodes parallax and permits small movements so it doesn't feel like you are watching a video.
But still worth watching if just to see what VR will look like in the near future.
It is one of the best vr cinematic experiences yet.Praise Jesus my Lord and Savior.

Its a Felix and Paul production so expect some very high quality experience. Its very short but if you like dinosaurs this is the real deal (your other option is the awesome Robinsons Journey). I hope to see second part soon! PS. YOU DON'T NEED OCULUS REMOTE TO PLAY. Touch work just fine
Although it was fun at first, the movement of the camrea really started to make me sick.  Kind of wish they had not moved around so much.

love the idea of full movies like this. The video needs to be higher quality and some interaction would be good too! This is a cool demo with a lot of potential. Right now it's a one and done but I could see future videos having a lot of replay value if done right

Great idea with tons of potential!   Lacked any sort of in your face VR interaction and the picture was too grainy and choppy.  Seemed ametuer compared to the majority of rift experiences.  I hope they adjust the quality and tweek the story.
wonderfull

review_title: Motion sick before it even started
one_reviews_text: I give the developers some credit for releasing this for free but this title is not doing the Jurassic Park franchise any favors.  Go see Coco's free content from Pixar if you want to see how to do it right.  This title made me motion sick right from the opening 'Universal' credits.  The gameplay itself is 3DOF and drags the camera around without your input = bad time.  The dinosaur looked like it was animated at 15 FPS and I have a 5930K CPU and a 1070 GPU.  Uninstalled after less than 30 seconds, so maybe it got awesome later but I wasn't going to risk getting sick for the rest of the day to find out.
Low FPS, low resolution.... meh... deleted

review_title: If you've never experienced a GREAT VR,
one_reviews_text:
this might be cool and interesting! 

However, if you've enjoyed some of the more advanced and awesome, high quality experiences, this isn't worth the time. Unless you're a Jurassic Park completionist, I guess.

one_reviews_text: But not a bad one. Sadly only seemed to be 3 DOF. However while for me it was missing some sharpness (and not just due to limited Oculus resolution), it was still a very good looking dino experience
Finally a glimps of what a movie could be like in VR from a major studio.im excited for the future of VR movies.

It's kind of cool for what it is, but extremely short. There's really no point to it, other than maybe a cheesy 'prequel' to a cheesey movie. I think the video is about 3 minutes long. The dinosaurs interact kind of awkwardly and unaturally, which I nick it for because that seems like the whole point behind the video.

Wow, not sure about all the negative reviews but this is by far the BEST dinosaurs demo I've ever seen in VR!  Especially when it's FREE!
I normally don't write reviews but WOW nice job people!
I liked the short Jurassic World demo for the Gear VR a few years back, this is a bit similar, but I'm not sure it's even better. Expected a bit more...
Frame rate was really low, running on a moderate gaming PC. The experience is rather short and typical. Kids loved it.
It's free, and it looks and feels great. Would like to see more of this kind of stuff. It really makes you feel the presence of dinosaurs.
I thought it was really good, and it was free. Loved the volcano erupting, and all the haze and burnt stuff after. I thought it was pretty realistic.
Nice

Probably one of the best experiences i have seen, cannot wait for chapter 2!!!!!
I Think a Film Studio is THE best company to make experiences for VR.

i give 4 stars because its just a little bit too short at the moment (DUH)
it runs good @ i5 3570K(4.3Ghz) with an RX580 (8GB)

Might be relatively enjoyable on the Oculus Go, but I felt it was too blurry for me.
360˚ Videos are a waste of time in my opinion.

Soon we will join the dinosours. But untill then. I would prefer to watch these experiences with a proper method of adjustment to height and never again see something rendered with improper eye distanced cameras. (It seems like all these movies are like this unless actually rendered via your computer.) Theres allot going on in this scene which is cool. But seeing it in at least the same resolution as the Rift would be nice.
Having seen Jurassic Park when it first came out in theaters, which was awesome.  This was an amazing experience!  Felix and Paul stuff is always good.
It runs now.  Kind of cool to be in the world.  There is no sense of dread or fear to be had but interesting anyway.

review_title: Needed amin rights to run it
one_reviews_text: I had to run the jwb.exe with admin rights manually, otherwise it would just open and then immediately close.
Its ok I guess. But it seriously reminds me that VR seriously needs a resolution Boost
i7700k/1080Ti, image was smooth; Quite short but definitely cool experience. Must see!
I don't see others mention it, but the video plays choppy for me.  GTX 1060 6 gig, i5-4670 @ 3.4ghtz windows 10.  Any reason why it would be?
review_feedback:
Good morning!

We're sorry that the video is choppy for you. We will look into this error, but we do need a bit more information from you in order to investigate properly. Please private message us on our Facebook page, with your issue and your email, and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Thank you!

one_reviews_text: Crappy, blurry 360 degree video. Plus, very boring content. Really not worth your bandwidth.

One of the best 360 3d videos I´ve ever seen.
I usually don´t like 360 videos, but this is awesome! but the video could be a better image quality

Click start, see an hourglass for a second then nothing.  Nothing ever shows on the CV1, Windows 10 Pro build 1803.  It works fine on 8th gen Intel system that I tried it on but I'm guessing they're somehow blacklisting older CPUs (probably without knowing it).  Every other Rift app/game I've ever tried has worked.  Of course I have GTX 1080 but because I'm using an old i7-980X CPU, they don't want to work with me.  I've tried this experience and it's cool but trust me, my CPU is way overkill for your app so would be great if you fixed it :)

I think you should try this if you've never watched VR before and like dinosaurs.
Any other varience of exp, don't.
...as a first time experience, but after a year or so of top notch experiences this pales in comparison.
They could make an entire Jurassic Park movie in VR. It would be amazing.
3d VR video with awsome quality and perfect CGI
It was ok, I'd save your time though.
didnt work
Looks great but way too short, just a few minutes. And not interactive, it's just a video. Takes more time to download and to install than to play it :( Try Robinson.

Really good experience for a short, free demo. Will definitely be showing it to my friends and family

review_title: Has a great potential for a movie

We're sorry to hear you're having problems using our application. Please note that the gamepad support only extends to the A and B buttons for selection and uses your gaze to move the cursor. We hope you will be able to enjoy our experience.

one_reviews_text: Performance of the little movie ist terrible. The Delevoper didn´t put much effort into this.

review_title: Little short but it is awesome
one_reviews_text: I want this to improve and make more. It is interesting witnessing some of Blue's adventures.

Great experience! Keep up the good work.

You don't need oculus remote! I almost missed this because of the warning. Although I may be the only one who were not aware of this.
Much higher quality than all the generic 360 VR content out there.

This is a short, good looking trailer. For a 360 movie, it's well rendered. Just don't expect any interactivity other than looking around. Blue is cute. Not "Disney" cute, but cute just the same. Will be looking out for more.

Sadly this title crashes immediately on startup on my i7 970 cpu and GTX 970 and reverts back to Oculus 2.0 home screen. Which is a shame as all other Oculus titles run fine. Wonder what the problem could be?

Its short but its great! and ITS FREE! I can see a lot of potential for bigger projects like this!
Low resolution  but  good 3d photorealistic  and its free
i loved this :)
i love it! cant wait for episode 2!

one_reviews_text: So you get to see dinosaurs fighting it out in the wild. The graphical quality is not the best, but it's still pretty good. Purely cinematic VR experience with no interactions. Whole experience is about 5 minutes long. Worth the download.
review_feedback:
Good morning,

Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad you enjoyed Jurassic World: Blue, but we would like to make your experience better.

We would appreciate as much feedback as possible, in order to fix whatever graphical issues your having. If you wish, please private message us on our Facebook page with your computer specifications and your email, and our quality assurance team will get back to you ASAP.

Thank you!

one_reviews_text: For 360 video, it's actually pretty good (VR video is usually pretty awful). But the entire video is only a couple minutes long, not particularly interesting, and ends just as it gets good. But you know what, it's free - so give it a download and see for yourself. It's certainly worth a couple minutes of your time.

Not working for me at all either. Takes me right back to the oculus screen. Running i7-7700 with GTX 1060. Every other app has worked, except this one. Too bad, I was really looking forward to seeing it work.
